bug.author: rahular
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.10.1 Python version: 3.7.7 Operating System: Linux-3.10.0
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I am trying to restore a previously trained model from a different run by specifying the run_path. But it still seems to be ignoring it and searching in the current run's folder. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>> load_path = wandb.restore("best_model.th", run_path="rahular/nlp/o9yf2jxr") Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/home/wjv316/anaconda3/envs/pos-bert/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/sdk/wandb_run.py", line 855, in restore raise ValueError("File {} not found.".format(path)) ValueError: File wandb/run-20200918_164521-1n2653n1/files/best_model.th not found. </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.76. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rahular>@rahular</denchmark-link> we'll fix this in the next release. You can run to restore this to a working state for now.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rahular>@rahular</denchmark-link> , it looks like the run in question used wandb version 0.10.1, so the file isn't saved to . It could be saved to your next run which seems to be have been run in parallel, but it will exist on your machine in the directory, under your project. You did find an issue in our messaging for cases where restoring a file failed. Thank you for that, and good luck.
